comments.body: This isn't going to work for v1.1; see https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.1/hack/jenkins/e2e.sh#L168

Oh, I guess they get overwritten in v1.1's `e2e.sh`.  I'm wondering what happens when v1.3 changes; do we have to go back and change v1.2 as well?  It's not the worst thing in the world, but it's not great either.  It just scares me a little that we're tightly coupling logic across multiple release branches.
The hope is that the labels won't change from now on.
At least add a comment that these should work across all versions we're upgrade testing at any given time.

> The hope is that the labels won't change from now on.

I think that's an unreasonable hope, but we can cross that bridge when we come to it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +150,154 @@                export E2E_UP="false"
                export E2E_DOWN="false"
                export GINKGO_TEST_ARGS="--ginkgo.focus=\[Feature:Upgrade\].*upgrade-master"
        - 'kubernetes-upgrade-{provider}-{version-old}-{version-new}-{step}':
            step: 'step4-e2e-old'

@@ -1,1 +166,170 @@                export E2E_UP="false"
                export E2E_DOWN="false"
                export GINKGO_TEST_ARGS="--ginkgo.focus=\[Feature:Upgrade\].*upgrade-cluster"
        - 'kubernetes-upgrade-{provider}-{version-old}-{version-new}-{step}':
            step: 'step6-e2e-old'

comments.body: `project-env` and `job-env` are pretty ambiguous.  Add a comment?  (Project is per-upgrade-flow, job is per-step, right?)

That's right, done.

As with e2e tests, there's quite a bit of refactoring that can be done in here.
